definition: to rush to/to hurry to
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to go to/to head for/towards
(used in given names)/variant of 奔[ben1]
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)

sentences.english: They were set on leaving for the front right away.
sentences.chinese: 他们打定主意立即奔赴前线。

sentences.english: After six months of studying we were supposed to go to the front and receive the rank of lieutenant there.
sentences.chinese: 经过六个月的学习后我们会以中尉军衔奔赴前线。

sentences.english: They rushed more troops to the front.
sentences.chinese: 他们急速调派了更多的部队奔赴前线。

sentences.english: And we don't have much time left to make that journey.
sentences.chinese: 为了奔赴征程，我们剩余的时间已经不多。

sentences.english: Two months later, they were married and he was off to war.
sentences.chinese: 两个月后，他们喜结良缘，随后父亲便奔赴战场。

sentences.english: Vice Premier Zhang Dejiang has gone to the Zhangjialing mine to supervise the rescue operation.
sentences.chinese: 副总理张德江已经奔赴张家岭煤矿进行援救监督工作。

sentences.english: Two months later, they got married, and then, my father went to war.
sentences.chinese: 两个月后，他们喜结良缘，随后父亲便奔赴战场。

sentences.english: A palpating heart, covers many miles for your fervent breast.
sentences.chinese: 敏感的心，渴望奔赴，千里之外，你的胸膛。

sentences.english: He ordered su to the front.
In order to cure your hangover, you must therefore attend church as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 因此，为了醒酒，你得奔赴教堂，越快越好。

sentences.english: Manchester City will once again visit North America for their pre-season training camp.
sentences.chinese: 曼城将会再次奔赴北美作为新赛季的赛前集训。

sentences.english: Vice Premier Hui Liangyu rushed to the site with a team of experts and officials.
sentences.chinese: 国务院副总理回良玉带领一个专家组奔赴灾区。

sentences.english: Unto a greater uproar tempts his veins;
sentences.chinese: 却嗾使他的血脉，向更大的骚乱奔赴。

sentences.english: They made a living in Shanghai during the slack seasons of farming and returned during the busy ones.
sentences.chinese: 他们多在农闲期奔赴上海谋生，又在农忙时返乡务农。

sentences.english: They ordered him to the front.
Vice Premier Zhang Dejiang has gone to the Wangjialing mine to supervise the rescue operation.
sentences.chinese: 副总理张德江已经奔赴张家岭煤矿进行援救监督工作。

definition: to hurry/to rush
unrelenting/without stopping to rest
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
(of troops) to depart for/to head for
to travel to (a distant place)
to hurry to (somewhere)
to set out on a journey
to leave for/to proceed towards/to go
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
to arrive/to reach (a destination)
to come/to arrive
that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
to travel to (a place where duty calls)
to return to/to come (or go) back
to travel day and night
alone/by oneself
